result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Stockman

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:15 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM735, 22CF477, 22CF742, 22CF990.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CM735>>
State moves to DRI Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct); COURT grants. 

22CF477>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin); COURT grants. 
Count 5 (Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin); COURT grants. 
Count 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia); COURT grants. 

22CF742>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 

22CF990>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Manufacture/Deliver THC <=$200g); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

21CM735 Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY.  

22CF477 Count 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC >200-1000g)>>GUILTY.  

22CF990 Count 2 (Manufacture/Delivery THC <=200g)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 22CF477 and 22CF990:  SWH for 2 years probation. 
COURT ORDERS on 21CM735:  SWH for 1 year probation; all counts concurrent with each other.   

CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  SAFE assessment intake and completion.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations on 21CM735.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and any domestic abuse surcharges.  

Probation review hearing in 21CM735>>11/11/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  1:35 p.m.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:57 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM735, 22CF477, 22CF742.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 

Date and time set for preliminary hearing in 22CF477 and 22CF742.

22CF477>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

22CF742>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

COURT sets PTC 8/10/22 at 2:20 p.m. 

Adj:  10:59 a.m.
